ygData.subject: Re: Leveling
ygData.msgSnippet: Admittedly there are a LOT of places you could kill but the best depend on where you are. Most commonly people kill around entrance to Crushbone or
ygData.messageBody:
Admittedly there are a LOT of places you could
kill but the best depend on where you are.<br><br>Most
commonly people kill around entrance to Crushbone or
inside CB around 7,<br><br>Or they go to East Commons
and kill animals and insects or camp orcs there at
level 7.<br><br>EC is safer in terms of a place to
kill.<br><br>If you're 7, I'd recommend a full decent group or
someone higher level to watch your back.<br><br>I take a
few of my guildmates in CB when they're lower levels
and PL them in there. TOO many players now a days
play in so many other places that CB trains are almost
a nightmare.<br><br>Used to be CB was overcrowded.
Now it's sparce and you have to be very careful.
People playing in CB these days seem too pell mell.
Lotsa people that I try to train but never
learn.<br><br>When your only healing in the group is two rangers--
and your enchanter of level 7 says, "Stay put-- our
two tanks are at less than 3 bubs of health."
followed by "40"<br><br>Used to be USUALLY when I said it
in CB. People realized I meant I had 40 mana, and
there's no real healing-- stay put before
pulling.<br><br>Now a days, for some reason, I see my two tanks run
off and pull. Not once. Not twice. But three
times.<br><br>First time was a Leg, second was 3 slavers, third was 2
legs and a slaver. Then I have everyone hold up on CB
safe ledge... I see a train run by and the guy sees a
group on the ledge and actually turns into me and runs
off as it kills me.<br><br>Alright, I hate that I
rant about this BUT...<br><br>WHY??? Do I sound pushy
when I tell my group firmly "stay put"?<br><br>Come
on. I might be a newbie essentially still, but I've
also learned a lot about grouping and used to kill in
CB forever.<br><br>shooman out<br>Fatedhue
Prismatic<br><br>PS... yes. I know. Sigh. Sorry. I gotta learn to stop
ranting at times.
